intro: Reseda papillosa var. duriaeana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or yellowweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Reseda papillosa var. duriaeana is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
